statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -4 \\ 3 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ -4 \\ -5 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 4 \\ 13 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 8 \\ 18 \\ 10 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -4 \\ -3 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -4 \\ 3 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ -4 \\ -5 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 4 \\ 13 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 8 \\ 18 \\ 10 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -4 \\ -3 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
